message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.HC, cs.MM, cs.RO 

The paper discusses the use of deep learning techniques for real-time semantic segmentation of users' bodies in video streams, which is a common topic in computer vision (cs.CV). The paper also focuses on integrating users' bodies into an augmented virtuality scenario, which falls under the category of graphics (cs.GR). Additionally, the paper discusses the potential benefits of seeing user's bodies in virtual environments, which relates to human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The use of stereoscopic RGB video streams and neural networks for segmentation also suggests a potential application in multimedia (cs.MM). Finally, the paper discusses the feasibility of using such techniques in real-time scenarios, which is relevant to robotics (cs.RO).
